title: Can’t fault MSI
body: MSI have been amazing. I filled out the online form to book a consultation due to their phone line wait times being too long (not an issue and I completely understand why they are so long!). The whole process of filling out the form, having my 2 phone calls and taking the tablets took less than 3 weeks. The first time I called the advice line, they picked up after 10 seconds which was amazing. Thank you so much for your support and assistance and keep doing what you do!

title: Don’t bother
body: Had my assessment October 2021 - to be given a care plan and diagnosis - no explanation of what the diagnosis meant or what it even was it took Google to answer my questions, now may 2022 and still waiting for the care plan to take action. Called multiple times for updates or info and may as well brew a tea in a chocolate kettle. No steps are being taken and even after calling them after 3 suicide attempts for clearly needed help I was told they’d call me back which they never did. As a mental health facility I’m not shocked the suicide rate is so high when this is the help we get from a specified mental health clinic!

readBy.name: Essex Partnership University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Appalling staff & Service
body:
Never experienced such a poorly staffed and under funded service by the NHS. Only a couple of their staff seem to be able to do their jobs and care. You get passed around a lot, and only get treatment if you keep begging.

Took over 20 months to get treatment, which isn’t even a 1 on 1 psychology therapy, it’s an external service instead. They try to push you back to iTalk, irrespective of your illness.

Group therapy is a waste of time as the nurse can’t control the group and it’s left as a free for all. Nurses talk about their own problems and don’t listen or read your file before speaking to you, often triggering you. 

The reception staff are either very rude or somewhat pleasant depending on who you get. They show zero compassion for the patients.

The wellness team just tell you to go for a walk, or treat you like a child, just awful. Only 2 staff seem to be passionate about helping their patients, the rest act like robots ticking off a list.

The psychiatrists are untouchable, only speak to them every 6 months if you’re lucky. Only 1 so far seems to have listened and shown compassion. The rest prejudge and just want you out of the room with your meds to fend for yourself.

Staff love talking about themselves, and don’t actively listen. They seem to forget that mental illness needs compassion and active listening, not preconceived judgements and indifference. It’s very much a paint by numbers service there.

If you can afford it, go private as you’ll either get worse or get hospitalised before they treat you.

I’d never recommend anyone using this service.

author: SPr22
title: Need information for my video consultation
body:
I have an appointment via a video consultation. I have the time and date but no clue about how it will take place.  
I have replied to the hospital asking if it will be by zoom, teams or something else but can't get a reply. Why won't someone talk to me?

author: Kia
title: Getting more contraception
body:
The nurse was so kind to me!! She made me feel so welcome. Was so helpful and answered any questions I had.  
Extremely pleased with the service I received. Such a lovely nurse!

author: Daphb89
title: Wonderful people treating me for melanoma
body:
The staff at Dermatology at Stirling Community hospital are all wonderful. I was initially seen by Dr Sinclair, who was great to deal with. The path of my future care was mapped out for me, and I was told that I have a medical team involved and interested in my case. I was also given the name of a counsellor, to contact if necessary.Today I saw Dr Scott, David and Iloiko. I have met David and Iloiko before, when they removed a small area of my skin to be tested for cancerous cells.  
Today I returned for removal of further cells.  
These people are wonderful. They are so professional, but they make every effort to relax their patients. I was told what was happening at every stage of the procedure. There was much light-hearted banter mixed with the information I was being given throughout.  
I have been an outpatient of Dermatology at Stirling Royal (now Stirling Community Hospital) for many years as I suffer from skin damage caused by a childhood exposed to strong sun in New Zealand.  
I cannot fault the care I receive from these wonderful people and I'm most grateful for their ongoing concern and care.

readBy.name: MASScot- Melanoma Action and Support Scotland

author: LyndseyMc
title: Birth of my beautiful boy
body:
Due to unforeseen circumstances in Craigavon I ended up being transferred to Daisy Hill hospital to have my baby boy.  
I just want to thank all the midwives from their kindness to helping me stay calm when birth became very difficult. I literally would not have got through it without your knowledge and fun at times.  
Special mention to Arlene, Ruth, Elaine and Elaine. You ladies were fantastic.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: MHamidi
title: Impressed by the speed and efficiency of my care
body:
I had a great experience of the dermatology unit at NHS Glasgow New Victoria hospital. I was referred by my GP and was quite surprised by the speedy letter to be seen in the clinic in less than 2 weeks from initial GP appointment.  
All the staff in the clinic were compassionate, warm and communicated clearly. I was seen by the registrar and then by the consultant and it was agreed that a removal of the problem mole would be recommended. This small procedure was explained to me clearly.  
The clinic was able to have me assessed and the small procedure done within 2.5 hours. Specialist Nurse Elaine and her colleague Elaine were caring, professional but kept me at ease. After care explained really well.  
I'm just so stunned by the efficiency and care taken. Thank you.

readBy.name: MASScot- Melanoma Action and Support Scotland

title: Lovely bunch of mixed clinicians
body:
Very helpful staff. The appointment system is good. Can usually get on the day appts. Receptionists very helpful and friendly
The staff are clinically good and attended to my needs. Friendly, listened to my concerns and addressed them. Definitely recommend!

author: Angie150
title: Still waiting for results of my CT scan
body:
My oncologist had requested a CT scan for me in April so that we may discuss the results at my next Beatson visit in May. Previous scans have been performed at my local hospital which is five minutes away from me.  
This time however, I was allocated an appointment at the Vale of Leven Hospital, Dumbarton. A round trip of forty miles! Since there was nothing I could do about changing the appointment to a closer hospital AND have the results on time, I made the road trip to Vale of Leven.  
All the staff I met on the day were very pleasant and very helpful. They even asked for the date of my appointment so as to request results were reported on time.  
Disappointingly, I attended my appointment with no CT scan results to discuss.  
3 weeks after the scan date I have called the scan department at Vale of Leven. The helpful staff could confirm that my scan has not yet been reported on and no one qualified to do so will be in the department that day or the next. They suggested that I ask my oncologist to call the department and request it is looked at more urgently. When they have the staff to do that!  
So time goes by again. And what happens if the scan shows something that requires action or treatment? How long will I wait to hear and how long will I be expected to wait for treatment?  
Why is the Vale of Leven scan department accepting people for scan appointments when there is no one to assess the scans or report on them? Ticking boxes again and I feel the patient doesn't matter. When will there be hope of receiving any results?

author: NHS Today
title: Felt welcome and safe at day surgery unit
body:
From the moment I entered the day surgery unit I felt safe, welcome and reassured.  
Every single member of staff from the gynaecologist, anaesthetist and nursing staff offered me exceptional care. I was treated with friendly efficiency and most importantly, I was listened to when I expressed anxiety about my reaction to anaesthesia and my allergies.  
The day surgery was extremely busy, but as far as I could see, every single patient was treated with courtesy and never felt the staff were too busy to listen or help. A truly remarkable feat with the volume of patients that day.  
My thanks go to each and every one of them.

author: Sept1949
title: They saved my life
body:
I was admitted via A&E. From the moment they realised how bad my situation was the speed I was dealt with was amazing.  
I was admitted Tuesday and by Thursday morning I had been operated on and they had saved my life. The treatment and care I received while on ward 4c was truly outstanding and I would like to thank everybody concerned from the bottom of my heart x.

readBy.name: St Helens and Knowsley Hospitals NHS Trust

author: mineralxd53
title: Maternity MOT Clinic
body:
I was referred to the MOT clinic at Wishaw hospital by my community midwife following some complications in early pregnancy.  
I attended my appointment last week and waited over an hour after my appointment time to be seen. I had a second appointment with psychiatry that I had waited over eight weeks for and when I explained this to reception and the person in charge of the MOT clinic I was told there was nothing they could do - forcing me to cancel my appointment and rearrange for the following week.  
The following week arrived and once again I have been forced to wait well beyond my appointment time despite having work to attend. I spoke to reception about how poor the clinic management is and I was told that this happens every week and it is not uncommon for patients to wait over an hour beyond their scheduled appointment time.  
If the clinic has such a large number of patients and is consistently so behind it is obviously necessary to run the clinic more frequently during the week.

author: Rice
title: Suggestion to improve noise cancelling in the scanner
body:
Having had several MRI scans across various hospitals, the usual routine is get changed, lie on table and put in yellow ear buds. Then some music plays to drown out the noise of the MRI machine.  
Would it be possible if we could get the yellow ear buds as the headphones are not that great at cancelling out the noise? It would make a real difference.  
Thank you.

author: decemberzp48
title: Good experience at well run gynae clinic
body:
Initially surgery for prolapse at gynaecology dept QEH, then continued to Stobhill. Prolapse returned after nearly 6 years. Referred back to pessary clinic QEH.  
Pessary fitted, but next one very uncomfortable and removed, then after 2 years of blood-stained discharge being attributed to prolapse, and more blood staining at 74, I felt this not right. I was referred to 1 stop clinic f at Stobhill. I did receive info leaflets explaining tests to be prepared might happen.  
From the minute I attended, Dr Varda was so professional, went over my history, explained procedure with camera then biopsy. She also asked my permission for student doctor to be present, and I was happy to agree.  
Then nurse Karen prepared me. So calm and again reassuring and knew her job so well. She explained as each part of the test went along, as did the very caring Dr Varda. Just the right amount of info from a wonderful team which made everything easier.  
I would have no fear attending this well run clinic again. Even Margaret who brought a cup of tea afterwards was so kind. Please pass my thanks to them.  
[Unhappy with 'Appointments']

author: dcoburn86
title: Thank you to the nice and knowledgeable staff
body:
A few weeks ago I fell and hurt my ankle. I rested it for a week before starting a job which requires a lot of walking. Despite the reduction in swelling the walking was causing me considerable pain.  
I attended the MIU at the RAH in Paisley because I was worried that I’d potentially broken a bone. My ankle was x-rayed and luckily there isn’t a break however physiotherapy has been arranged for me.  
Everyone dealing with was very nice and knowledgeable.  
I love the NHS. Thank you so much.

author: Hearts fc
title: Amazing care for my son on Ward 44
body:
My son was admitted to ward 44 after a longish illness. All the staff were amazing, very caring towards my son and gave myself lots of support.  
I never felt rushed if I had questions. They took time to say hello and check if we needed anything, always smiling and nothing was ever too much. I can't thank everyone enough, they are truly amazing. A wonderful ward with the most amazing people.  
Too many people to thank personally but thank you to you all.

title: Poor practice
body:
Southway Surgery has seriously deteriorated. It used to be excellent. It no longer is.

I suffer from anxiety issues and about a year ago my meds were changed when I was doing fine on the previous ones. The new meds were not working very well so about 6 months ago my dosage was increased. I was given a date for a follow up phone call to review how this was working. I took the day off. No one called. The new meds continue to function poorly, and seem to be causing bouts of depression as a side effect. Since many years ago I attempted to kill myself due to depression, this is potentially serious. After a particularly bad couple of days I called the surgery to explain that I was struggling with mental health issues. I was told that I would have to wait a month for a call back. When I pointed out that I never got the review call I waited in all day for, they said I would have to wait a month for that too. 

So I attempted to do an e consult the following morning instead. The email I got back informed me that I would recieve a response by 6.30pm of the following day. So I spent two days anxiously awaiting a phone call which was only worsening my mental health. At 2.30pm of the second day, feeling increasingly depressed and low, I contacted NHS111. They called me back almost immediately and spoke to me and sent an email to my surgery expressing the importance of them arranging for a doctor to call me within two hours. They didn't. I chased up my surgery on the phone, and got told they'd had computer issues and to call back the following morning. No doctor from the surgery has called to speak to me. An email from an NHS111 nurse expressing the importance of this appears to have been blatantly ignored. 

I also asked if I could go back onto my old meds, a few of which I still have left, pending a new prescription. Obviously the receptionist could not authorise that but I have to wait until tomorrow before a doctor can be bothered to find the time.

What is most unacceptable here, is that all this failure to get a problem addressed is actually worsening my condition, which fact the receptionist acknowledged. And far worse, the urgency the surgery was informed of by a qualified NHS111 nurse of a need to speak to me promptly was blatantly ignored.

This would never have happened in earlier years.

author: Cath1430
title: Concerned about lack of care and communication
body:
Seriously concerned and saddened to see my wife in danger of not walking again, or being able to stand to turn without moving and handling equipment and carers rather than with me.  
She was admitted due to a hip fracture and on discharge from ward 6, I, as welfare guardian, was not informed of the pressure ulcers which had developed during the admission, and no request was forwarded to community nursing for follow up post discharge.  
The nasty ulcers (worst area predicted to be grade 3) have resulted in pain, discomfort and delays to recovery and rehab; 4 weeks post discharge and rehab is yet to commence at home.  
I'm appalled and concerned about the communication and lack of care. My wife has mixed dementia, limited opportunities and time is precious. She may never stand to step and turn around or walk again, requiring equipment and carers for all moves. We may never be able to go out for a drive in the car together.  
The impact has been significant.

author: EC02
title: Put at ease for my c-section
body:
My daughter was born via c-section and it was honestly a great experience. The surgical team were all so lovely and welcoming and made it so special for us even though they do this all day everyday, and sometimes the outcome is not so positive, however you would never know as they never let it seem anything other than a calm, relaxed and happy atmosphere.  
The consultant (Paul) who delivered my baby was so nice and friendly. I didn't realise when he came to chat to us beforehand that's who he was, as you think a consultant might not have the time and be so personable.  
However he put us at great ease and done a great job! Rhiannan (anaesthetist) was also fantastic, as well as all the midwives and staff on the ward. Nothing was too much bother and they were all so lovely, so a huge thank you for helping a first time Mum feel supported.

author: Holiday12
title: Big thank you to staff of the Endoscopy Unit
body:
Had an ERCP at the Endoscopy unit last week. This is not the first time I have had to undergo a procedure in this unit, but once again I can only submit my gratitude and thanks for the treatment received.  
Since entering the unit until my departure, I was treated with respect, dignity and kindness. The staff kept me informed on everything that was happening throughout the day.  
A big thank you to Dr Bryce and his team - could not fault any of the staff in this unit. You are all a credit to your profession and the NHS is lucky to have you.

title: Great practice
body: Very helpful, polite and friendly staff, they go out of their way to help the patients. Getting same day emergency appointments is another plus. The staff are multi lingual which is a big help to the patients in the area. The doctors make you feel comfortable.

title: Very caring staff
body: Arrived at the weekend after midnight with heart attack symptoms. Dealt with promptly and efficiently. Heart attack confirmed and arrangements made for transfer. The staff from reception onwards were professional but what got me was their friendliness and proactive attitudes to checking on me, explaining, reassuring. What a lovely bunch of people.

author: Chelsieher
title: Our IVF journey
body:
Once finding out our first round of IVF was successful, shortly after we where given a community midwife, Mieke. She has been amazing from start to finish, has always been at the end of the phone when I've needed it. She made me feel very at ease when around her, made us smile and laugh. She is absolutely amazing at her job and anyone who gets assigned her as there midwife is extremely lucky.  
Was in the hospital for 1 night, the midwife's there where lovely. Very polite and well mannered when ever I had any questions. Helped when I needed it and didn't bug me when I didn't. Was home in the evening the following day with our baby boy. Grateful for all the midwife's that has been with us throughout our exciting experience. Thank you all.

title: Reception was fantastic
body:
My lady on reception is fantastic,
Super helpful and understanding,
Very professional thankyou again keep up the good work x 
Kerry Templeton x

author: Cloughreagh
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Cloughreagh House
body:
I came to Cloughreagh after being in hospital after a bad fall at home. I came with some trepidation, not having heard of it before but immediately on arrival, I got such a warm welcome and friendly help which has lasted throughout my stay. The staff were all very professional and that includes the physiotherapists, OT, district nursing team as well as the Cloughreagh staff. The accommodation is very comfortable and adequate for me and is kept immaculately clean. The garden is just coming into bloom and a pleasure to look at as well as sit in.  
In the era of face masks wearing and the difficulty of old age hearing, I feel it might be helpful for staff to wear name badges.  
Everyone has been very kind to me here and I will miss them all when I leave.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Fantastic team! Understanding, knowledgeable and…
body:
I was contacted really quickly after referral and after the initial phone consultation the "treatment" started immediately. The material has been really comprehensive and easy understandable.
The results have been amazing and made a huge difference to my life. Although the programme was hard to follow at times my contact at the Sleep clinic was incredibly supportive and encouraging. I've had regular progress calls and have been signed off after 3 months with all the tools I need to help manage my sleep challenges myself. I can't thank the team enough.

readBy.name: Royal Surrey County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Competent and Compassionate Care
body: I have nothing but praise for this practice. It is well run with a triage system and a holistic approach to health care. The whole person is central to the approach and staff are compassionate and flexible, knowledgeable and professional. I am quite blown over. I would recommend to all local residents.

author: Elaine03
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: It made me feel good and it was very relaxing
body:
My hair was greasy and needing washed. Elaine washed and blow dried my hair and it was sitting lovely. It made me feel good and it was very relaxing. It really lifted my mood.  
I love country and western music and Elaine played this for me, this also made me feel very good and it was relaxing.  
I loved talking about my family with her, talking to her was relaxing.  
I want to thank Elaine very much for doing my hair and making me feel good.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Professionalism
body: I've been a patient with Abbey Road surgery along with my mother, who lives with chronic illness for a number of years. I frequently deal with staff at the practice on her behalf from organising appointments to prescriptions. The high level of professionalism and care never ceases to amaze me. The receptionists, assistant practice manager and prescription clerk, not to mention the GPS themselves, truly understand their patients and treat us like members of their own family. It is heart warming to hear them refer to you by your first name and show sincere interest in your wellbeing or to receive a phone call to remind us of medication reviews etc. I work within the healthcare system also and this means a lot as far too many times patients are treated as statistics and not individuals. Abbey Road surgery certainly aims to avoid this and for this, keep up the good work. Upon visiting the practice, I have heard one or two comments from patients about how long they've waited etc however, I would like to suggest not listening to such comments and look at the bigger scheme of the NHS. In comparison to other NHS departments, Abbey Road surgery does well in adhering to the individual needs of each patient. A humble thanks to the practice and assistant managers along with all other staff members for their hard work and dedication. It's not easy but, keep up the amazing work

author: CWP
title: 12 months of lower leg neuropathy without proper diagnosis
body:
In May 2021 I started to experience severe dizziness and vertigo attacks. My GP referred me to the Haematology Clinic at Victoria Hospital, Kirkcaldy. An appointment was scheduled for October 2021. During waiting period I began to develop numbness/neuropathy in my lower legs. I told the haematology consultant about the problems I was having with dizziness, vertigo and neuropathy. The consultants opinion was that there was no connection to any blood disorder, and referred me back to my GP.  
My symptoms continued, and my GP could not determine the cause. Gabapentin was prescribed in November 2021. It was neither effective nor well tolerated, and the severity of the neuropathy progressed. In December 2021 I was prescribed Pregabalin, which was also neither effective nor well tolerated. Intermittent dizziness and vertigo, increasing leg numbness, and now chronic back pain caused considerable concern and mobility problems, and my GP referred me to the Neurology Clinic, Victoria Hospital, Kirkcaldy. An appointment was scheduled for March 2022.  
I saw a neurology consultant and they asked me a few basic questions such as do you drink or smoke?. They didnt carry out a thorough lower limb neurological examination nor visually examine my legs, back, or gait etc, and did not advise any blood test, glucose tolerance test, or any of the other additional tests available for proper neuropathy diagnosis. The consultant told me they would refer me for an MRI. When I asked whether they thought my leg neuropathy or related to my back pain, They informed me that they did not have a clue. And that was that; very disappointing. I don’t think the ‘consultation’ lasted more than 10 minutes.  
To deal with the neuropathy and progressively severe back pain, my GP prescribed Co-codamol.  
I had an MRI of the Lumbar Spine in April 2022, at Queen Margaret Hospital, Dunfermline.  
It is two months since my visit to the Neurology Clinic, and a month since the MRI. I tried to contact the neurology department on several occasions without success. Finally, a week ago, I did get through to my consultants secretary’s office. To cut a long story short, I was assured that an email would be sent to the consultant stressing the urgency of delivering their letter/report to me without further delay. A very brief letter from the consultant was received today. They have not presented any diagnosis, but has referred me to a neurosurgeon!  
Now over 12 months has passed since I first consulted my GP with symptoms - which have progressively worsened. I am taking Co-codamol, and spending a good deal of time lying down, as the continuing numbness and pain often limits my mobility. Over the course of the past year I have discussed my condition with several GPs at my local practice and seen two consultants at Victoria hospital. No thorough clinical assessment nor neuropathy diagnostic tests have been carried out, to date.  
I would have thought that accurate and timely diagnosis of any debilitating neuropathy is important to avoid progression of nerve injury and permanent nerve damage. Surely there must be someone within Fife NHS who possesses the necessary experience and skills to assess, recommend appropriate tests, and accurately diagnose my condition and advise a course of action. If so, who should I be seeing?

title: Good service
body: I had very good service from the front desk & all the medical staff, thank you all.I found all the doctors to be very professional & the nurses who take the blood brilliant, all this in a very difficult time we are in at the moment.

author: otterlyawe26
title: Improper Care in A&E for bad sunburn
body:
I came back from being on holiday early due to being severely sunburnt and struggling to walk. As soon as we came back, I rung 111 where they advised me to attend A&E. When attending A&E, I was greeted with an obnoxious receptionist who seemed to not care. After explaining that 111 advised me to attend A&E and that it was for sunburn. All the individuals behind the reception desk said we don’t treat sunburn, which fair enough I understand that they are doing their job and sunburn isn’t an emergency but I couldn’t walk and the blisters were leaking everywhere. I had to show them a photo of my legs for them to understand that it was a problem.  
A&E waiting times were not too bad but once through into my own room. I waited 2 hours to be seen, with no instruction of what was going on. Anyway a doctor came through asked questions and then told me they need to do blood tests. They left and a nurse came in and put pressure on the blisters to pop them and then just wrapped my legs in bandages. That nurse said I’d have to keep going to my GP to get the bandages changed. However, when the doctor came back in the room with Eurax cream, he told me to take the bandages off after 12 hours and apply the cream and I’ll be fine by Sunday. It was currently Thursday.  
Once they all left the room, I didn’t know what was happening. Was I waiting for a blood test? Could I leave? It took 10 minutes for then another nurse to come in to ask if I had been discharged and then finding out for me that I had. At this point I had less mobility and more pain then I did when I came in to A&E and none of the wiser to what I was doing next. So much so, the next day I had to ring my GP to find out what to do and what was advised but to my surprise there was no record of me going to A&E until they got someone who could access some system to find out.  
Overall, following the orders I had been given from A&E which turns out made it worse, I got admitted into hospital just over 24 hours later where they were surprised that A&E didn’t call up to them for a proper course of action originally.

title: Outstanding service by Dr D Hogg
body: I just wanted to thank the staff and Dr Hogg for the fast and efficient treatment I received this morning. Even under the immense pressures they face, dr’s and nurses still continue to maintain such a high level of profession and care thank you Jess

author: attendantrc74
title: Helped to get back on my feet
body: In January I was having surgery, consequently I had a Stroke. I was firstly taken to a ward at the Victoria Hospital. They are very busy, nice staff. I spent a little over four weeks there before I was transferred to The Stroke Ward at Cameron Hospital for Rehabilitation. There is a very good team here and they helped me a lot, nothing was any trouble. Although I have my worries with speech the staff stopped and took their time to listen to me and what I needed. I became very anxious and nervous the staff calmed me down at all times. Physiotherapist are amazing and pushed me to get back on my feet. I understand that occupational therapy helped get me home also. I ate and drank well too. Sometimes the ward was a little noisy at night.

title: Very professional, impressive service.
body: My partner and I did research before choosing this Surgery. All the people we have met in there are kind and helpful. The receptionists are very patient and give us good advice how to proceed. The nurse and the doctor we met are great.

author: Ziggywiggy
title: Podiatry appointment
body: I had a podiatry appointment in Banbridge health and care centre mid May with Ashley from I entered the room with Ashley I was very aware she was good at her job explained everything she was doing so I could fully understand she cares about her patients did help me immensely.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Excellent practice
body: Very good doctors and staff so prompt and excellent service and  I never have complaints about this practice

title: Great Practice
body: Very friendly and helpful and all the staff attends the patients very quick. Doctors are nurses are very much kind enough to solve your queries

title: Lovely staff
body: We took our mother in and she was very confused and difficult but the staff were lovely and very helpful.

readBy.name: South Tyneside and Sunderland NHS Foundation Trust

author: Ksmith
title: My daughter's health visitor
body:
My daughter was born September 2021. Myself and my Health Visitor Gayle suspected that something wasn’t quite right with my daughter’s feeding and bowel movements. At first we tried gaviscon for reflux to try to help feeding. This made no change. Gayle continued to try and find a solution. I then showed Gayle my daughters nappy after a bowel movement and she immediately put my daughter onto allergy milk for suspected cows milk allergy. Initially things seems to improve, my daughter gained weight but her bowel movements remained the same. Then suddenly the weight gain slowed, Gayle arranged to see us monthly from then on to monitor the situation.  
Gayle referred us to the doctor and to give a stool sample but everything came back fine. Gayle still continued to visit and asked for us to have a paediatrician appointment. We are now waiting for this. My daughters weight gain has been a lot better and this is no longer a concern, however myself and Gayle hope the bowel movements can be looked into and maybe get some help with that. Gayle is still going to come out to visit my daughter after the appointment with the paediatrician to see if there’s anything she can help with.  
To be honest I can’t fault Gayle's help she has been supportive from the beginning and only wants to make sure my daughter is healthy and thriving.

title: PCN alcohol counsellor
body:
The help and understanding of my situation have been of the highest and most professional standard possible. The counsellor has guided me on methods for monitoring and ways in which I can cope with moments of stress, weakness and circumstances where I might regress.
The PCN has always been available and the follow ups have been supportive with reviews of the periods between the consultations.
I definitely consider that I have turned a corner and will continue with what I refer to as my treatment.
My thanks to the PCN and the NHS for providing this service and hope it will continue to be funded in order to help others who have the same or similar illness.
 
 supo

author: ethan46
title: My detox experience
body:
Every member of staff made me feel very welcome from the moment I came into the building as I was suffering with a lot of anxiety. All treatment was of the highest professional level.  
The property felt very homely, not at all clinical. I feel like I've truly benefitted from the workshops and involvement in all activities.  
My only criticism is that the service is completely non-smoking, giving up cigarettes at the same time as other addictions was incredibly challenging.

title: Amazing treatment and care by the staff
body: I had the best care from the moment I stepped into whiston to the minute I stepped out. From triage to going into the A&E was brilliant. I had such a lovely F2 doctor, she was amazing from start until she finished her shift and I couldn’t not thank her for they way she was so kind and outgoing in all she did. As her shift was finishing, her ‘supervisor’ I think she called him took over my care and it was finally so nice for someone who could relate with have server sore throats etc. he was brilliant and within a few hours I felt refreshed and ready to take on the world again. I can’t thank them enough for their patients with me. I’ll highly recommend this hospital for their care- youse two doctors and nurses who helped are truly one in a million, we would be lost without youse!

readBy.name: St Helens and Knowsley Hospitals NHS Trust

author: swingyk54
title: Treated with respect
body:
All good.  
Nice staff.  
Treated with respect.  
The nurses were kind and considerate and professional. The treatment was done with care and I never felt any discomfort or pain.

title: Wonderful Nurses
body:
I visited the Urology Dept. TWOC Clinic on Monday 16th. May.
From the time I was called in to the time I was discharged, the Nurse and support staff was so caring making my visit so pleasant and feeling at ease.
Seeing the way all the staff in the Urology Dept. was going about their duties, made me think, these are the people who deserve Medals, Thank you all, Richard.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent surgeon and after care.
body: Had my thyroid removed following a MEN 2A diagnosis. I was quickly informed and operated upon. The surgery and aftercare were excellent. I needed some outpatient care and this was very thorough and I felt listened to and involved throughout. I'm very grateful for my treatment.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust (2)

title: Fabulous GP practice
body: Every member of staff from reception to the nurses and GPs are really helpful, friendly and totally committed to your health and wellbeing.  Friends and family who are at other practices do not have the same experience.  I'm very grateful for the support and expertise that I've received

title: Suggestion for improving physiotherapy advice
body: The physiotherapist filmed me, with my phone, while I was doing exercises under her guidance. This is an excellent way to remind patients what to do but it could be even better. I used my phone’s video editor to rotate the video so that it appears to be from my point of view. This makes it extremely easy to mimic the exercises, especially as it matters whether they are done right/left or clockwise/anti-clockwise. Rotating the video reduces the chance of doing the exercise the wrong way round. I suggest the physiotherapist advises patients to rotate the video in this way.

title: Always helpful
body: I’ve had a couple of appointments in the last couple of months and on both occasions I’ve felt well looked after. It was easy to get through to reception and both times I was offered an appointment within 24 hours. Great practice, very much appreciated

author: centauruswz84
title: Pretty jolly
body: You have all been pretty jolly. Never been cheeky and listen to what I want makes me cups of tea. I've enjoyed your company if someone asked me I'd say you can't get better than you!

author: Cassiope58!
title: The light bulb moments
body:
I was referred to this service realising I needed some help though wasn’t sure if this was the way to go or not. Could I deal with talking about things i knew would be difficult?  
There was a long waiting list, I was aware of this and of course Covid created even more delays. It did take a while ,mental health services are woefully understaffed in this and many other health care settings..  
I was nervous that first day when I met my therapist, in fact I was shaking. As I now know I was overthinking it all! She was very easy to be with and made sure to explain how theses sessions would all go. so after that first session I went home thinking “yes I can do this”  
The sessions went on week after week, I did my homework and J continued with her guidance and revelations about myself . Life bulb moments as she called them and they truly were. I went into these sessions thinking nothing I say here in this room will make any sense, everything will be disjointed but how wrong I was. A pattern began to emerge which I never would have seen on my own and I could actually start to see why my behaviour is as it is. I was astonished to realise how far back this stemmed from and now it makes sense. I’ve learned so much about my thinking, my personality, my learned behaviour and much more.  
My therapy with J is just finished after quite an amount of months. I feel better about myself . j managed to give me confidence in myself, saw things in me I didn’t see. If you ever find yourself in this department wondering why on earth am I here, I don’t know what’s going on and a lady walks into the room with you saying her name is J and I will be your therapist Don’t worry, you are in the best and safest of hands who will expertly guide you through and even have a laugh or two with you on the way.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: velafh68
title: Encouraging wellbeing courses
body: I've been attending the creative wellbeing course at recovery college. It's encouraging and provides strategies for coping with mental health.

title: Health check
body: The surgery seem to be really thorough. Communicate well. Getting in touch regularly to update situations. Have been all through Covid too.

title: Consistently good care
body:
I've been with this practice since 1985 and have been really impressed throughout the years.  In December last year I brought my mother to London from a care home which she hated and where her health deteriorated rapidly.   This practice took her on and has looked after her well until she died two days ago. She had multiple medical problems so sometimes I'd be contacting a doctor every few days.  But I was never made to feel that I was taking up their time and I always got a sympathetic response.  That was important because being a full-time carer takes its toll and you can become quite emotional if she's in distress or if someone is less than understanding.  The support I got was really needed and I very much appreciated it.  This morning I let the practice know that my mother had died through AskMyGP and within five minutes I had a lovely call from the surgery.   They've also just agreed to take on my husband who has a mobility disability and I'm so pleased.   
Thank you to all the staff who make it a place to be proud of.

title: Cataract surgery
body: I had my first eye cataract surgery carried out on Tuesday morning 8.30am  my appointment was on time, all staff were very helpful and polite, the procedure was efficient and painless. The outcome amazing very much looking forward to my other eye done. Well done to all staff

readBy.name: South Tyneside and Sunderland NHS Foundation Trust

title: Shocking
body: Received ultrasound results by text from GP who I've never seen before so she doesn't know what I look like or who I am but thought it was ok to tell me that weight loss would help my problem, how did this Gp know that I may be already struggling with my mental health and this rude comment may not of helped my situation, and not only that what they found was not the reason why I saw the gp in the first place so the text was extremely unhelpful, Barcroft seem to of lost there way and no patient care anymore, such a shame used to be a good surgery with reliable Dr's but no longer..

title: Power Assisted door
body:
Thank you for all your hard work and providing excellent care to my mum. With mum’s declining mobility, she is now using wheel chair. Does the surgery door has power assisted entrance? ie door stay open when button is pressed to enable carer to push wheel chair in. 
It gets difficult to keep door open with one hand and push mums wheel chair with one hand to enter surgery as it needs more force to push over bumps. (We came for COVID-19 booster). I asked reception but they were unaware. I would be grateful if this can be looked into. 
Once again thankyou very much for excellent care. It means a lot.

title: Poor service
body:
This is my first pregnancy and I had not seen a midwife since I was 28weeks because I changed addresses. I was finally booked to see one at 36 weeks. I had booking bloods taken the previous day and I saw a haematology specialist earlier that day (which went well). On getting to the midwife, she could not wait for me to leave. My bump was not examined. At the end of the appointment, I had no idea what presentation my baby was, if it was engaged, my baby’s HR was not even checked. I had no info about my pregnancy. I left disappointed. 

From the moment I walked in, she was like, you were seen earlier today as well as yesterday and I insisted it was not by a midwife but that did not change her approach. She just booked me for the next appointment. In fact, that appointment would have been shorter had I not had some questions for which not all were answered.

At 36 weeks, she simply booked me for the next appointment at 38weeks, knowing I may have gone into labour. What if my baby is breech? No one knows.

readBy.name: Sandwell and West Birmingham Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Shocking
body:
I tried to contact the go surgery for a possible ear infection in both ears. I rang from 8am listened to the automated message to then go on to another automated message that says the phone lines are busy please call back and then it automatically hangs up ! What a stupid system , why can’t it just have a engaged tone instead of making you Sit through the long message each time , this surgery is getting worse. 
I’ve heard so many bad reviews on this surgery over the last few months it’s a disgrace that it’s still allowed to operate , I will be changing practices! If your thinking of registering here please AVOID

author: homamtg96
title: Excellent care
body:
To Jody and Colleagues,  
Thankyou for the excellent care re my leg.  
It has been more appreciated and escpecially the jokes!  
We wish you all well for the future.

author: waltzmq74
title: Bad Patient Experience - Concerns not taken seriously - Help withheld
body:
I've suffered from pelvic pain for years and am usually told that I'm just not exercising enough, or that I'm exaggerating. The pain is chronic, but not incapacitating, so (although I would rather not have to) I've been able to just deal with it for some years.  
I had my COVID booster early this year and almost immediately began to suffer from excruciating period-like cramps. In early March I came down with a very bad stomach bug which badly exacerbated my existing lower abdominal pain, so I went to the GP and asked for a scan to rule out anything more serious.  
I was told that people are not referred for scans unless they've already been seen by a specialist and I can only see a specialist if the GP feels there's a need. The GP performed a standard check by pressing down on my abdomen, when asked if it hurt to touch I said no because it's not the outside part that hurts, it's the inside part that radiates pain to which ever part of me is facing the ground. If I'm standing, the pain will be around my pelvis and hips, if I'm lying down my lower back will hurt, on my side then it's my side that hurts etc.  
At this point, the GP told me there was nothing of concern there because it didn't hurt when she touched me and I was added to a waiting list and told that there was no way of knowing how long it would take for me to be seen.  
On the Friday, I began to notice a heavy, ball of pain on the right of my lower abdomen that felt like it was dragging down my right side, extended down my inner right thigh and putting painful pressure on my bladder/urethra. It wasn't excruciating, and from experience I knew that nothing would be done unless my life was obviously in danger, so I didn't bother to call the GP.  
By the Sunday, the pain had gotten much worse and I was becoming frightened. I called NHS24 and was asked why I didn't speak to my GP on Friday. After I explained and answered all the questions required of me, I was told to go take painkillers and use a hot water bottle. I told them I hadn't taken any painkillers that day because I've tried them in the past and they do nothing for my pain. They don't even touch it. The operator told me that if I wasn't trying to help myself, they wouldn't refer me to see anybody. I agreed to take painkillers and call back in a few hours.  
When I called back and explained my situation again, the operator said that an out of hours team would call me back to let me know what the course of treatment would be.  
When I received the call I was again asked to explain what my issue was and the operator asked me what I wanted them to do about it. I told them I was hoping they might be able to tell me what can be done and was told that they could only send me to an out of hours clinic where I'd have to explain everything to a different person, have my abdomen pressed and be told there was nothing of concern again. I said that wasn't going to help me in terms of pain, or in finding a solution to my problem, and was told that their only concern was keeping me stable until I could speak to a GP on Monday so I could ask them to bump me up on the waiting list. I was then offered painkillers, which I refused because painkillers do not help with these issues. Throughout the call the person referred to my pain as a sore tummy.  
I called the GP on Monday morning. Different GP to the one I'd already spoken to, so I had to explain everything all over again. GP wanted to rule out a UTI, even though I suffer from recurrent UTI's so am familiar with the symptoms and am fairy certain this is not a UTI. I explained this but conceded that I understand these kind of things need to be ruled out. So she asked me to drop in a sample to get a dipstick test done. I wasn't able to that day because I was going to a funeral in England, so I asked if I could do it today instead. GP said that was no problem, she'd leave a sample bottle at the desk for me to collect and I could get it dipstick tested that day to confirm if it was an infection or not.  
I was held up with work so called the medical practice to make sure that it would still be alright for me to come down this afternoon and was told that, although the lab pick-up was at 2pm, I could still go down and leave the sample to be collected tomorrow and have a dipstick test done.  
When I got there I was told that the GP had printed a label for a dipstick bottle but put it on a lab bottle. They can't do dipstick tests on a lab bottle, or submit a lab bottle with a dipstick label on it and the GP didn't leave detailed enough instructions. So I need to go back again tomorrow, to be tested for a UTI that I definitely don't have. The receptionist couldn't tell me anything about my place on the waiting list.  
I'm still in an ever-increasing amount of pain, frightened that it could be serious and at the mercy of of medical professionals who can't give me a good reason to believe that there's nothing to worry about.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

links.id: lack of good knowledge about menstrual health

author: avocetgf45
title: I was made to feel so welcomed
body: I was made to feel so welcomed, relaxed and looked after. Anything I needed to ask, was answered for me. The staff were wonderful, even the ones who were looking after other patients. They would ask if I was ok on the way past. I felt safe from the first port of call to getting in the car on my way home. I would recommend this unit to anyone. Everything was explained to me step by step and they ensured I fully understood what was just explained to me. My stay was great. These girls are certainly angels, even my strong cup of tea hit the right spot, and the sandwich was fresh and lovely. I have not got 1 fault. Well done to each and every staff member who I saw.

author: Malcolm85
title: Colonoscopy Victoria Hospital Kirkcaldy
body:
I was quite apprehensive prior to my appointment in May 2022 at the Day intervention Unit at the Victoria Hospital Kirkcaldy.  
From the minute I went in, I was put at ease. I cannot thank the staff enough. From the Nurse Clare who did my checks to Doctor Wilson who did my procedure, everyone was fantastic at their jobs. There were other nurses who dealt with me unfortunately I can’t remember their names but they were fantastic.  
10 out of 10 from me!

author: bonanzabx69
title: Appreciate everything
body:
I appreciate everything that has happened so far. I'm a little scared about reducing and felt a little pushed to do so in such a little time, that was by a particular person.  
Two other prescribers were very nice and other then the above, I am happy.

author: charakr43
title: Heart issues
body:
Chest pains and short of breathe. After being asked to report to A and E for cardio admission, I was shocked to see so many sick and worried people left in chairs for so long. I was approx 15 hrs before being seen.  
The Integrated Assessment Centre ward (IAC) felt like a war zone. I was left by a bed at 4am and had to make it with sheets left at end of bed. I was not seen by any ward member until later. I was not sure to get in or onto the bed.  
The different types of needs from lots of patients was vast, and I saw many elderly people upset and crying.  
I moved to cardio 2 days later and it was a blessing after what I witnessed.  
Even the cleaning and support staff were amazing and caring. Only on this ward did I feel I was in care.

author: greenbx44
title: Excellent service and care from Forth Valley minor injuries
body: I would just like to take the time to say how truly grateful I am for the speed and care that my 15 year old son received from Stirling minor injuries department. We phoned NHS 24 this afternoon due to my son sustaining an injury after playing rugby which resulted in a very swollen and bruised foot. Within 20 mins of calling NHS 24 and speaking to a nurse, we had an appt at minor injuries within the hour. The staff at minor injuries were very helpful and had assessed his foot, taken xrays and confirmed it was broken within an hour. The member of staff was extremely helpful and informative and overall the experience left me feeling very proud and grateful to have this type of service available. Thank you very much for us both.

title: Good service
body:
I called at 0800 on Monday and despite being #20 in the queue got to speak to a Dr later that morning. An appointment was made to assess my condition on Wednesday in a face to face meeting where I also received treatment and fixed an appointment to see the physiotherapist the following Thursday.

That is good service.

author: Cal Flame
title: Great staff Ward 401 at Aberdeen Royal Infirmary
body:
Tuesday was an in patient admission for my ablation procedure.  
Cannot say enough about my experience from start to finish, from the admission and pre procedure process and after care of the staff at ward 401 when I came back to the ward.  
Of course the staff at the Cath lab who made sure my comfort and well being throughout the whole procedure was second to none.  
We are so lucky to have such dedicated professional staff working at the hospital.  
Also the Consultant Cardiologist who carried out the Ablation who kept me informed of the procedure was also second to none with his professionalism and dedication  
The Consultant came round after the procedure and informed me that the Ablation had gone well and was positive of a good outcome.  
That was reassuring.  
Thanks to all of them for the care I received while in hospital

title: Thankyou Riverside
body:
I have been at the surgery now for many years, and seen a lot of changes over this time, unfortunately due to covid and people moving, retiring, leaving the practise, etc its had a tough time, as has the rest of the profession. But the level of patient care and professionalism emerging now is second to none in the area.
I've had help well above and beyond of what should be provided, after surgery hours consultations because of life changing medical decisions, genuine heartfelt care, and strong desire to help people, from really talented gp's and nurses
There have been times due to recruiting new staff where training is required that you sensed just a lack of knowledge sometimes on the front desk, but that now is so different and the reception teams are so helpful. Much better waiting times now on the phones too.
I think its an amazing surgery at Riverside and can't recommend it highly enough.

title: When the Surgery keeps you waiting
body:
I Received on May 5th a text from The Rivermead Gate stating that a late morning appointment had been made to discuss some recent test results.
By 12.30 the call had not materialized I cut my afternoon plans as I was going somewhere not telephone appropriate. Still no call.

This is not the first time this surgery has missed an appointment with me, the last time they put it on my NH record that I had missed the appointment. Duh! This really is the most shabby Medical Practice and not to be recommended.

author: golfce89
title: Great program
body: I was referred to C.M.P at a time in my life when I was very low and crippled with anxiety. The help that was given to me by Marie and Anne-Marie was second to none. They taught and reminded me of knowledge, techniques and practices to enable me to come to terms with my bereavement, grief, anxiety and depression. There was not enough space to list all the help that was made available to me. From resilience to relaxation, sleep problems to motivation, the program has helped me with practical, usable techniques that I use more or less every day. All presentations were well constructed and easy to understand and any queries I had, were dealt with promptly by two very knowledgeable and professional people. Special mention must be given to Marie and Anne-Marie. I felt that they were utterly brilliant. They listened to me and very quickly became more than just voices on the phone. They made me feel supported, cared for, listened to and helped me to progress with my many problems. I cannot thank them and the program enough. I miss them now that my involvement with CMP is over. Thankyou from the bottom of my heart.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)
Northern Health and Social Care Trust

title: concern
body: I just popped into surgery as needed to be  seen ASAP only to be told this is not a walk in centre, the person I spoke to had bad attitude, in the past, if you needed to be seen they have said you will need to wait till after the surgery finishes and you may be waiting a while, this must be no longer happening yet while I was waiting, a person who was there said to me they rang up 30 minutes before I had arrived and got appointment, eventually I saw someone who triage me advised to go to hospital went I was told by them to go back to GP.

title: Great Practice
body: Did an econsult last night about my daughter, received a call @ 08.10 from the care nagivator who then added me to the GP Triage list, spoke to GP @08.30am, who prescribed abx for my daughter. Great service, very please, especially it being a friday

title: Centre in chaos
body: My wife as tried repeatedly to get through to make an appointment for something which may have serious health consequences. After 5 attempts yesterday she connected and was told to ring back today at 8:30. She tried but a message instructed callers to ring off because they're too busy. What is she supposed to do?  The system of everyone ring at the same time is dreadful, other busy practices manage to take appointments during the day and even have days when patients can turn up and get seen. If there's a staff shortage, this needs to be highlighted by our media so something can be done about it.

title: Waiting for people to die
body: This shambles of a practice is frustrating from the phone call right to when you get to speak to a medic. The doctors refuse to see anyone face to face, and if they call back, the won’t do much other than give platitudes. My mother has spent more days in a&e this year than at the surgery as they just won’t see her or do anything about the issues, and we are forced to take her to a&e. it’s becoming ridiculous. I feel like they are just waiting for people to die, or they have doctors who are too afraid to treat people

title: Incredibly Long Wait Time
body: My husband fell and hit his head and I suspected concussion so called an ambulance.  He arrived at A&E at roughly 11pm and it is now 9am the following day and he is yet to be seen.  He's has asked if there is any indication of when he might be seen or the treatment he's expected to receive and no luck.  Another patient before him had waited 12 hours with no information.

readBy.name: Sarah Champion's Office, MP for Rotherham

title: Awful
body: This practice should close down. Complete and utter deception to the public. After trying a number of days by coming In early, almost the first person, and being on phone from 8 AM, the only reply is “we only have emergency appointments left.”

title: Used to be great - not anymore
body: South Lewisham Group practice used to be amazing - sadly they’ve now become ‘Modality’ and getting an appointment is impossible with glitching phone lines (caller number one in the queue for over half an hour after calling bang on 8am) and powerless staff to help. Such a shame. Really hoping things get better because the service is shocking.

title: Absolute shambles
body: Not being able to speak to a doctor, let alone see one, have chronic illnesses mainly respitory. Even 111 phoned them on my behalf.

title: Incompetent
body:
Despite the surgery receiving a communication from an external specialist to add a prescription to my record, and a chase up call (waiting time 15 mins to get through) from me 7 days ago, I called today (10 min wait time) and the doctor still hasn’t approved the prescription and added it to my record for collection. 
This isn’t the first time I’ve had problems with incompetence at the surgery. Maybe the Practice Manager should read these reviews and provide an explanation, so far not a single one has a response! Maybe that says something about their interest in providing an acceptable level of service!

title: Unable to comment
body: Unable to comment on care as I have yet to attend the surgery!  My criticism is the length of time to actually get an appointment.  Rang on 19th May to arrange a face to face appointment, only to be told first available one is 7th June, when I will be called “any time after 2.00 pm”.  I don’t think my symptoms are serious, but not being medically qualified, can’t say for sure.  Why such a long wait for a telephone call?

title: Sad it has a poor rating
body: In 8 yrs I have been more than satisfied with the service from this practice. My ongoing illness now has changed my feelings. Many excellent doctors who are guarded by some less than excellent front staff! Treatment from one doctor in particular has lifted my confidence and pushed to get me a life saving diagnosis quickly. I hope the difficulties I have experienced this month will not become the 'norm'!

title: Totally dysfunctional "appointment system"
body:
Everyone must ring starting 0800 hrs as the receptionist told me that is the fairest way. This means 20 plus patients trying to get through at once so you are in a queue and then have an option to select 5 on your phone for a call back. They lack honesty and integrity because I was 19th at 0805 then 22nd at 0940 and was still waiting at1330 so I was lied to and would never get that call back.
Rang again 1330 held on this time for 1.5 hours until I spoke to the receptionist.
Tell me what was wrong with the online booking system or calling in and asking for an appointment.
This "service" is not fit for purpose. 
Here is an extract from a statement on one of their information pages. 
We are a medical centre based in Croxteth, Liverpool. We are a forward looking and innovative practice which aims to give our patients the highest standard of service. The standard of service I see now is terrible and unacceptable. 
Why do the G.P.s work 2 or 3 days a week? If they worked 5 I'm sure we could all have a satisfactory service which we have and are paying a fortune for. 
Is the team too obsessed by their hobbies and have home life balance too far weighted to home life?

title: Appointment booked for 9am, and no waiting and…
body: Received fabulous advice and support when attending an appointment for Bloods and BP 20th May. Friendly and approachable with excellent communication.

title: Unlike
body: I have been ringing past 3 to 4 days requesting appointment at 8oclock in the morning I am either or they put the phone down. It is emergency regarding eye

title: Disappointed
body: This GP Practice never answer the phone. When finally you are able to get through. There is no way to get an appointment of any kind even phone consultation. You're told to phone next day but its the same answer the next day. No wonder A n E are suffering. Because we're told if you're that bad phone 111 or A and E. 111 are always engaged too! What are we supposed to do?? It's not like my Husband and I are regular GP Visitors we only call if really necessary! I think it's a disgusting state of affairs!

title: Brilliant Hospital
body: Spent about four hours in the hospital yesterday, 19th May, and was made to feel welcome and cared about from the word go. The staff were all fantastic, I was really looked after.

readBy.name: Lincolnshire Community Health Services NHS Trust

title: Have to wait long time in surgery to be seen
body:
I had a face to face appointment at a certain time. I have to always wait over 30 min to be seen. It is not fair as I have to take time off work to attend my appointment.
Something needs to be done to ensure patients are not waiting a lengthy time to be seen.

title: Not a satisfactory consultation
body: The GP I saw had no time to discuss issues. Was rude, uncaring and made it clear I had my 10minutes consultation. This was my first and last consultation with this particular GP and have since left this practice.  I understand the pressure GPs etc are under, however to be told I had my time limit and it would not be fair on other patients to keep them waiting was not acceptable. I have had to wait many times and had to put up with being seen later than my appointment time. At  the age of 75 I would have expected to receive appropriate care and consideration. I will add however, after years of being a patient this was the first occasion I have been treated so badly.

title: Very bad experience
body: All staff treated me like I was not a person. The staff -nurses and Drs are so rude. No respect for others. I would not recommend.

title: X ray Dept. very unhelpful bordering on lazy
body:
I am currently undergoing diagnosis by my GP for a mystery ailment. Following numerous blood tests, she sent me to the Xray dept at Erith Cottage hospital for a Urgent Xray. It clearly states on the form that a 'walkin' is available and no appointment is required. I arrived on 20.05.22 at around 09.15. Apart from 2 members of staff behind the reception, there was nobody else present and no patients waiting. I handed over my paperwork and was told by the radiographer that she had no available time and that the next available appointment was not until 30th May. When I pointed out that this request was Urgent. She simply said "Sorry, I cant help'. 
If the paperwork clearly states the Xray is urgent and the hospital advertise they carryout 'walkin' patients for urgent matter's, why are the staff so reluctant to help. In the meantime my diagnosis is delayed further and I have to continue suffering with severe pain and lack of mobility. Fortunately, my visit to Queen Mary's having been refused treatment at Erith Cottage, went far more smoothly and the staff were both pleasant and extremely helpful and understanding.

author: Rita83
title: Hospital at Home Team, Co. Fermanagh
body:
We were very fortunate to avail of the wonderful County Fermanagh, Hospital at Home team. My mother was referred to this service by her GP due to suspected pneumonia.  
Doctor, Irena and her team of excellent nurses, attended mum for six days during the acute stage of her illness. Doctor Irena is a very knowledgeable, diligent doctor who treats patients under her care with great compassion and empathy. The hospital at home team administered an I.V. antibiotic, introduced a nebuliser, took blood samples and sats daily, organised an X-ray and contacted the community respiratory team on our behalf. Doctor Irena went above and beyond the call of duty, even ringing on her way home on a Friday evening to give us an update! In six days mum went from being lifted in and out of bed to recovering her independence, all in the comfort of her own home. Family and friends are so impressed with this service and hope it will remain in place. We are so grateful to this exceptional team and their level of care.  
Kind Regards  
Rita83 and family

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

title: Very caring doctor and staff
body: While having a restful break in Coniston I had need of a GP. I phoned late afternoon and got an appointment, in person, the very next morning. Doctor Fischer was thorough, very pleasant and explained everything she was doing. She made me feel that for those 10 or so minutes I really was entirely what she was concentrating on. This made me feel safe in her hand and, in a very good way I guess we would all like to feel with our GP. However for most of us that feeling has been long gone for many years. The two ladies on reception were very friendly in person and on the phone including offering to drop a proscription of as the practice is also a pharmacy. The counter staff also being trained dispensers and the practice also does blood tests. With all this warmth my proscription still when straight back to reception/pharmacy before I had chance to ask and everyone seemed knowledgeable and caring. Thank you

title: Good surgery poor aftercare
body:
My husband had a knee replacement at Circle Hospital - surgeon and his team fantastic however discharge procedure and aftercare leaves a lot to be desired - I rang up after husband was discharged less than 48 hours post op and asked for a doctor to call me back as my husband was in agonising pain ! No call came and staff on the ward didn’t seem to appreciate my concern 
I have rung again this morning ref the discharge notes which failed to advise how many days post op the dressing needed to be changed as it was unclear on the discharge notes 
When being discharged I had to ASK for a wheelchair and for his sick note which had previously been requested 
At discharge no information was provided by the discharge nurse as to when he had had his last lot of meds and I wrongly assumed this would be included I. His discharge notes ! To say the staff on the ward were laid back is very disappointing because the hospital itself the room the food the surgery team were fantastic but discharge and aftercare communication really needs to improve

title: Fantastic service
body: I rang the surgery this morning, was promptly called back by a very friendly receptionist, and told I could come to see my Dr at 9-40am. I am very grateful to you all, as my mind has instantly been put at ease. All the staff are very approachable and kind. Your service was nothing short of fantastic, many thanks.

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: They are doing brilliant
body:
Accident and emergency was lovely and received good care, the staff there all were really nice people.  
When I was taken up to here I could already tell I was going to be taken care of the doctors ensure I know what is happening and what they plan on doing. I have to say though that some patients are very rude to the staff and they definitely do not deserve it. Everything has been okay in the time I have been here.  
The staff here are so nice and they cannot do enough for you.  
They are doing brilliant and I cannot complain.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I could not fault one person since I have been here
body:
I came into accident and emergency through GP referral. It was very busy but that is to be expected. I have to say they get a lot of abuse which they are not entitled to it is a disgrace.  
The staff are brilliant, I could not fault one person since I have been here.  
Female surgical is brilliant, the food is very very good and there is noise but that is to be expected since it is a hospital. They need more staff everyone is over worked but that is a worldwide problem.  
The staff are so friendly, and helpful if there was a scale out of 100 they would be 110. They explain everything to me and they do not sugar coat it.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: First class hospital
body:
I came in by ambulance, into accident and emergency and it has been superb. I was not waiting and there was a doctor and all waiting for me as soon as I got out of the ambulance.  
The staff there are lovely and friendly. Overall, they are so efficient at what they do.  
Female surgical is great the food is brilliant, we had steak and I knew it was good since I could eat it and I do not have much teeth! I have received nothing but the best level of care.  
The staff are excellent, brilliant there is not enough words to describe them. I am being well informed by them and they ensure I know what they are talking about. The nurse last night- Fiona was lovely she had a lovely personality.  
Nothing to improve, this is a first class hospital.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Shagq75
title: Phenomenal
body:
Female surgical is good, the food is excellent although I am only allowed a certain amount due to my condition. It is also lovely that the person beside me is nice. I have been kept informed the whole way through my care and treatment. The care I have been receiving is brilliant.  
The staff are excellent and very very kind. They never stop and they do everything for me they can do. They are phenomenal every single one of them.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
